page.title: 16LOWER BARNSLEY FARM
page.content: Lower Barnsley Farm has been in the {Purchase}family since 1940 before that the previous farmer was Mr Hansell who was a tenant of Mr Jack Smith. The land has been farmed since pre_roman times. The farm was in Royal Wimborne Manor at the time of the original Domesday survey. The proportion of the land used is, winter wheat 36 acres, winter barley 90 acres, spring barley 62 acres, potatoes 7 acres, and 30 acres of pasture on Pillsmoor. There have been two changes recently firstly the dairy has been closed as it is no longer economic and a battery hen unit has also been closed down for the same reason. . The farm is 265 acres (104 hect.) There are several{buildings including, corn store, drying barn, and calf houseing. There was an old settlement behind the barns.{Pop. of farm 13.
